com.milk.uberchat.iface
Interface ChatLocus

All Superinterfaces:
ChatEntity, Commandable
All Known Subinterfaces:
ChatChannel, ChatChannelHolder, ChatIdentity, ChatUser
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseChannel, BaseChannelHolder, BaseIdentity, BaseLocus, BaseUser
public interface ChatLocus
extends ChatEntity

This interface represents any locus of users, including a chat identity, a channel on a chat system, and a user on a chat system. Some methods may make more or less sense then others in a particular context (e.g., getKnownUsers() applied to a ChatUser is mostly pointless). Note that a locus generally encapsulates a source identity, so, for example, if a chat system allows for a single connection with multiple active identities, there could be multiple ChatLocus objects for the same effective locus in the system, one for each of the active identities.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1998-1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

Method Detail

addListener

public void addListener(java.util.EventListener listener)
Add a listener for this locus. If the listener is in fact a LocusListener, then the listener gets initially sent userAdded events for each user in the locus.

ChatLocus objects are also the source for MessageEvents. Adding an MessageListener to a ChatLocus should cause that listener to be told when messages come in from the host system (speech or otherwise).

Specified by:
addListener in interface ChatEntity
Parameters:
listener - the listener to add
See Also:
LocusEvent, LocusListener, MessageEvent, MessageListener

getTargetIdentity

public ChatIdentity getTargetIdentity()
Get the identity that this locus is directed at.

Returns:
the identity for this locus

getTargetSystem

public ChatSystem getTargetSystem()
Get the system that this locus is connected to.

Returns:
the system for this locus

getKnownUser

public ChatUser getKnownUser(java.lang.String name)
Given a canonical name, return the user in this locus with that name, but only if the user is already known. That is, asking for the name does not imply that it should be found, and no querying of the host system should be done to satisfy this request.

Parameters:
name - the canonical name to look up
Returns:
the user found, or null if not

getKnownUserCount

public int getKnownUserCount()
Return the number of currently-known users in this locus.

Returns:
the count of known channels

getKnownUsers

public ChatUser[] getKnownUsers()
Return the list of currently-known users in this locus. That is, no querying of the host should be done to satisfy this request.

Returns:
the list (array, actually) of currently-known users

updateUsers

public void updateUsers()
Ask for the list of users currently in this locus to be updated from the host. This may (and in fact should) return quickly, after which a series of userAdded and userRemoved events may be expected to be broadcast to the listeners of this object, as appropriate.

speak

public void speak(java.lang.String kind,
                  java.lang.String text)
Speak in this locus.

Parameters:
kind - the kind of speech (see SpeechKinds for details)
text - the message text
See Also:
SpeechKinds
